L4LWcEmxvyTospkGdTuT7w.text: Please try out this gem! We arrived before our reservation (for 3 at 8:30pm) and were seated promptly. Our server was so kind, walked us through the menu and guided us towards the Chef's Special, prompted by our request for something spicy and with tuna but with a brand new twist. Well they DELIVERED! All of our rolls were mouth-watering, and for a fraction of the price of any sushi joint on the strip. Well worth the taxi ride! The next time we are in town, we will eat at Bocho Sushi!

i_0UqU9wsaNfyJ1vMGSZXw.text: This place was fabulous. We got there right when they opened. So everything came out fast. Our server was also the bartender (who was somewhat new). He was super friendly and kind. We had their fried chicken, omg. Definitely need to try! So light and the sauce was amazing. I think they should incorporate the sauce onto a sushi roll! Then we had the Pokemon roll (my favorite) the dirty Sanchez, the Hawaiian and the ragin Cajun. All delicious.  The place is two stories. First is just the sushi bar then upstairs had tables.  I did only see one bathroom upstairs..  But all in all, super good sushi with good service and a clean restaurant.

aoW0Oqus9my0CcVuoGrnhQ.text: Solid experience and excellent, fresh sushi for our first visit.  We would definitely go back.  Made a reservation for 4 and ended up with 2 of us, so we sat at the sushi bar on the main floor.  We never went upstairs to scope out the seating arrangement or how large the space was.  Seats were comfortable, the sushi chefs were personable and knew their stuff.  We ordered:  Hamachi kama (Bocho bites menu = very tasty and my first kama), the 6th and Carson roll (excellent!), Something Wrong (chef's choice - excellent!).  Chef asked us what we wanted and he made a roll then drenched it in Screaming Orgasm sauce = YUM!  We also ordered nigiri consisting of the following:  blue fin tuna (a special), Hamachi, escolar and unagi - all fresh and tasty.    Restroom was clean.  Public parking available just north of Bocho and across the street, currently $2 per hour.  I recommend you check it out!

LaACxf7m2x_YjcA_1CkZ1w.text: Sadly I was not impressed with my visit. We went for a late birthday lunch for my sister. We were seated quickly which was nice! That's about where the good service ends. They weren't necessarily rude more so not very professional. When refilling my water our server spilled water all over my feet and didn't even apologize. However, my sister did enjoy her sushi! I enjoyed that they had a vegetarian option for me. We ordered spring rolls which were not ready until we were just about ready to go. Overall the food wasn't bad but the slow service just didn't help.

6AyuUCw8HjGx-a9JoAbQGw.text: Was here for a quick late lunch after work.   They don't have regular seating before dinner, so we sat at the bar. I am not a fan of high chairs but they were not that bad.   The place is a bit loud, but I guess that is expected for a hipster place.   Disclaimer: I am not much of a sushi guy, so I got non-fish things. (My boss wanted to try this place.).  The cons:   I did not get utensils or napkins until I asked for them.   In the bento box: The pork belly seems like just some pork that was pre-cooked and just charred to heat. The salad was way overdressed.   The ramen noodle bowl was for some reason cloudy and spicy.   The tempura was really heavy.   The pros:  The place is super hipster. If you want to do a photo shoot, this is the way to go. I hear they have a private room for karaoke and that sounds like fun.   They also have Happy Hour which is 30% off the menu

BcjET53Vlb-CTGiqOG0HIQ.text: Remember that 2 stars means, "Meh.  I've experienced better."  And 3 stars is, "A-OK." Sadly, I can't say my encounter with Bocho Sushi was "A-OK."  I was disappointed, and in fact, a little embarrassed that I dragged a work colleague here.  To be candid, as much as I really am sheepish about leaving a low-stars review, the "Meh, I've experienced better" is the distinct impression I got from my visit to Bocho.  That was in terms of food, service, and environment.  I was put off immediately by the greeting I received, which was less than warm, and seemed as though I had made a gaffe in asking to go upstairs to what I knew (from Yelp reviews) to be where the dining room was.  It is not permitted before 6pm, and for "Happy Hour," one has to sit at the bar.  And the "hostess" said it as though EVERYBODY knows this.  And she chided us as if I had asked to use the restroom in a five-star dining room, coming off the street, when I was not even dining there.  Whatever, lady!  I didn't even know or remember you had a "Happy Hour."  I wasn't there for Happy Hour.  I was there for Happy Dining! And happily leaving hunger behind...that's all. Sheesh.  It did not get a whole lot better.  The bar seating was cramped, with too many bar stools stuffed together (though the bar stools were really cool, stylish and a trendy orange). Most of our fellow diners were REALLY (I mean, extremely) friendly with the "sushi" chefs, who did not seem to hold the intense, studied expression of the average sushi chef, but maybe that's because they had to withstand these middle-aged ladies who were openly flirting with them, instead of focusing on what they were doing.  (Hey, I "ain't mad" at them, but a little attention on what you're doing would work, too.  And it's okay to be happy and love what you do! Most sushi chefs really get into preparing the food--but I didn't see that here).  It appeared to me that this was a fun hang-out for those who already are "regulars."  The lady next to me went on and on about sushi "chef" #1's haircut: "Oh my! What a nice haircut you have! I love the swoosh on the side! When did you get it cut?" And so on, and so on.  That was going on all around us.  It's quaint, don't get me wrong.  But it was weird when not one of the sushi chefs--who were making our food--bothered to engage us, or smile in our direction, or ask how we were enjoying the food.  We definitely got the feeling that we were outsiders.  The server who chided us for asking about upstairs dining did not help much in introducing us to the menu despite our saying that we were new there, and asking for help.  So we muddled through it.  The food was lackluster.  I ordered the yellowtail with jalapeno.  (Bocho is a Mexican Japanese fusion idea.  Very cool concept.  Bocho="Mexican who cannot speak Spanish," or at least that is what the sign on the side of the building says).  The dish was very pretty, but the fish was a little warm, and did not strike me as super fresh.  Maybe I'm wrong about that, and if I am, my apologies.  But I have had fresher sushi at  Smith's, no offense.  (The Smith's on W.Charleston has really good sushi, by the way!)  The "Poke Monster" was all show.  Sure, the poke & seaweed on top were fine (again, the fish part, the poke, did not taste super, super fresh as expected), and the tempura was fine, if a little dull and over breaded (I think the oil might not be hot enough), but it did not bring the spice it promised from the menu, and I did not taste the crab at all.  I wondered if it made it on the dish?  The little bean sprouts or noodles or whatever at the base of the dish were not a good taste at all.  It gave a sour note. The little "edible flower" that came on top, an orchid, didn't seem too edible!  It was dry and hard to eat...and I've eaten those before.  My colleague did not enjoy dinner, either.  Our drinks were not replenished, but food was taken away before we were done.  The music was really loud, and a bit more chaotic than should be played for a serious sushi place.  (Please see the excellent and entertaining documentary, "Jiro Dreams of Sushi" and you will know what I mean).    Worse, when I went to the restroom, I was a little put off by the lack of attention to it.  It was not filthy by any means, but it was not sparkling clean as I would expect for a place where RAW FISH is served.  For instance, the sink was a little grimy, the walls needed cleaning, and the light fixture, I would not touch without a towel.  I went recently to "Sweet Box," a dessert shop in Chinatown (with Japanese owners, I believe), and their bathroom was so clean, you might not even be grossed out having your dessert in there! I expect at least that much from a place that sells sushi.  All in all, not a good experience for me.  I do think it could be nice for tourists, and even locals who can invest the time into becoming a "regular," especially if they are drinking! Could have just been a bad night.

Mx2xmNCv_O-_5TGK30YrSg.text: Good and fresh!  Great location and nice vibes. There wasn't music playing because of the Super Bowl, but I would love to come back on another day to see what the atmosphere is like on a regular day. Overall happy with the experience!

9nP4Zz1L_oelNLIJvkBLjg.text: Bocho is one of my favorite lunch spots downtown.  Their sushi is super fresh and their chefs and wait staff are extremely friendly and attentive.  I'm always excited to bring my friends to try Bocho because I know they'll love it!

F471uxtquooo8ZuAe51kiw.text: Me and my best friend came here for a dinner date while she was in town. The restaurant is cute, clean, and hip. It's two stories with the bar downstairs and seating upstairs. It's also cool because it is in a historic building (some old famous Vegas hotel) and they kept an industrial vibe to the architecture.   Food was super good. A little pricey but delicious. The crispy rice appetizer was so bomb... HIGHLY recommend!   Service was awesome and we were even treated to mini cocktails on the house because the bartender was trying a new recipe out.

htAHxMSdmLhFf95beLNkVQ.text: Bocho has been my sushi spot for years. The servers are amazing!!! For a friendly place here. Bryan is awesome bocho couldn't have had a better server. There's just one thing now the sushi is not the same I don't know if they have been changing sushi chef, recipe or something but honestly the sushi is not very tasty. I use to love the way sushi here was made so tasty and delicious but we will have to find another good spot in Vegas.

5IA5JWAQh9LH9fPHIQsHfw.text: Overall it was a good meal as we got some sushi rolls and miso soups. The service wasn't so great as we had to ask for a lot of basic things like water, wasabi, the check and our appetizer soups came out with my rolls. My wife waited a full 5 minutes for her rolls after mine so just not a lot of coordination here. Seemed like some of the waitresses were new. Also, the miso soup was lukewarm and overly salty. I'd pass on that one.

SZQJe8gYtU4dspMEqRwZ2w.text: Came in for lunch on a Monday. Food was good and service was good as well. Loved the Spicy rock shrimp probably my favorite. Cool downtown vibe will definitely be back.

kdDFb6SbtQuJkLe0i4g_WQ.text: Restaurant lied to us when we called saying the order was taken by the driver 20 minutes ago after the order was already way late, and it should be here any minute now...30min later we got a notification saying the driver has now left with our food, and the order took a total of two hours and nine minutes instead of the one hour both othe restaurant and GrubHub confirmed. Sushi was OK, but there are definitely better sushi places with better values throughout Vegas.  Definitely not ordering from here or GrubHub again. Had to fight myself not to give a 1 Star just because the sushi wasn't horrible. Just ok.

ly2U2pPIe8RVjzZlXLXPeQ.text: We search in yelp and found this jewel. The tools are amazing and the two men making the rolls were very nice and accommodating. A few minor minuses...... on worker was not informative about specials, never asked for our drink order, and generally not happy to be at work. I will not takes stars away because the man and young man making the food were amazing and kind. I would differently recommend this place. The Poke monster roll is off the chain!!! The Dirty Sanchez roll is awesome. Please stop by and give them a shot you won't be dissatisfied or disappointed!!!

ejx64quJYmE0J_OC805tQw.text: This was a disappointing dinner.   1. The service was slow.  The restaurant was only half full.  2. The food was maybe a 5/10  The flavor was bland, the rolls had too much rice to my liking. 3. We ordered sushi: I waited over ten minutes for wasabi and ginger after the sushi was delivered.  I had to ask three times.  One waitress just said, no (she wasn't our waitress, but still) 4. The price was not worth the quality.  It's way over priced.  There's so many other places that are so much better especially in Vegas.    Party of 6 for a birthday celebration. On average from our party of six ranked it a 3.5 star. I know I will not be returning for sushi here.

RG07S_XHOufsv54EC3EmRA.text: This is by far my favorite sushi spot in Las Vegas- on or off strip. The food is unbeatable and the vibe is low key and relaxed. Friendly and genuine servers ready to help you order. I won't even bother naming the best menu items bc every single thing is *insta worthy*  if I could give 6 stars I would

AX09Ezz2FqQ72fOuAQXZGw.text: Will definitely return. We had the Disco Inferno roll which was spicy and delicious; the Bocho fried chicken app which were like lightly fried chicken bites; and mixed tempura. The highlight though was the eel and bluefin tuna sashimi which were incredibly fresh and good. Cool ambiance, very good house music playing, and nice sake selection. Service polite. Only downside is that the food took quite a long time to arrive which is why not the full 5 stars.

T8_e03Eb_EhelRUNxMqxCA.text: Great quick lunch spot in Downtown Las Vegas.  Very accommodating with the 2nd floor seating if you are entertaining a large party.  I normally sit at the sushi bar as the chef's are always very approachable and their service is incredibly fast.  I highly recommend trying their Shishito peppers and the Salmon Skin Roll ($5.50) is a great value.  My favorite two specialty rolls are the No. 5 (Crab, cucumber, avocado, cajun albacore, spicy tuna topped with crispy onions) and the Yellowtail lover (yellowtail, avocado, cucumber, spicy yellowtail).  When the crispy onions melt into the soy/yuzo sauce, you will ask for a spoon to shovel the tangy delicious mixture into your feed hole.

5N_PUHvcMRsuwUUvliAVbg.text: Beautiful service! I was craving sushi and this happened to be the closet one I could find. Even though, we had 2 children we were accompanied really well and didn't seem to be a problem. I had Ryan as a server who was very professional and recommended his favorite roles which were amazing. Philip was our servers helper and I was super impressed with his quality of work and making sure everything was out of the way for our next course and had everything we needed. I highly recommend this place very clean and organized but, it is a little overpriced but the quality make up for it.

Xw0b5gWFFolNoBLh6fRp-w.text: We waited 45 minutes and never got to try the food. We ordered a couple of appetizers and a couple of entrees and drinks. People on the next table (that arrived 30 minutes later than us) got their appetizers and we didn't so i aked the server and with a bad attitude he said they were too busy and will take a few minutes more. Then 45 minutes later i asked the server again about out food, he was not nice and asked the other server in a bad tone : can you please help this ladie? So i explained the other guy and he went downstairs and he came back and said: " oh, did they let you know that we don't have any more of the fish you ordered? I mean, really?  After 45 mins? So we left the place super hungry and mad. And off course we refuse to pay for the cocktail

o7O3QGd0eqUys-D0x0T-9w.text: The best sushi I have ever had and Geronimo was the best waiter, made amazing specialty cocktails.

FJdwud3k-spARrUbm1UlKw.text: Do you like to hang out and watch everyone's food getting made?  Then this is a place you would like to spend 2-3 hours.  So bring your $60 and have a nice night. If you don't want your food to take 30-45 minutes to get made and spending $40-60 person to eat then you should choose one of the other 50 places in walking distance. Also if you don't like loud music or spill over from the upstairs karaoke rooms then not the best place to spend your evening. This place stays busy, just make sure this is you crowd before visiting.

cTKpoxKeH97VzRJaY1eNCg.text: I work downtown, and finding a place that is good is difficult down here. With that said, I was super excited about a sushi place close to work!  And then I went.   The place is clean, and the staff are friendly for the most part. It is small, so it fills up quickly! The menu items are ok, but some things on the menu are seriously overpriced for the portions and quality (unless you get a bento box - those are a good price and you get a good amount of food). The shrimp tempura roll, Crunch Dragon, and the Rock & Roll are all good. That isn't my issue.  The issue is that when they ask "miso soup or salad," and you order miso soup instead of salad, you are charged extra. Several in our party had the same issue, and attempted to rectify the issue prior to paying. So the waitress left with our checks to correct them - and never came back! And when I mean never, I mean close to 45 minutes! Being on lunch from work this a) made us all late getting back to the office, b) ensured that we will not be going to Bocho again, and c) did not bode well in the customer service department. I believe that everyone has bad days, but when you leave to correct an issue and it takes nearly an hour for you to come back so that we can pay, there might be a problem. A big one.

V3B64b5h02wCaAbWDy_aIg.text: Would love to review the food but unfortunately after an hour and a half I am still waiting for it to be delivered...#hangry

p2QQ0Q9eF7YsgWwA79FnIg.text: During my first visit to Downtown Las Vegas, the homie suggested we get some sushi. Located down the street from Container Park, this small sushi spot is definitely a great spot for grub and drinks. The homie and I got a couple of rolls and some sake bombs. I was really impressed with the quality of the sushi. Overall, if you're looking for some delicious sushi in Downtown Las Vegas then definitely come check out this spot.

fpwJqkLAWbgAxHlcHjPTDQ.text: Just moved to DTV from Cali... And I found my local sushi joint! Great sushi, great servers, great atmosphere, reasonable prices. Banzai!

kQaqkLrG7dZY_QlhFu86PQ.text: I admit that I haven't been to many sushi restaurants around town except for Yama and Kabuki. Sometimes, though, I don't want to drive across town when I get a hankering for sushi. Lo and behold: Bocho Sushi. And they deliver! I've ordered the spicy salmon and spicy tuna at least half a dozen times. Great stuff. Worth the price.

1YkEVr9bcKh1dYuS1ykizg.text: We will have to make this a new tradition every time we are in Vegas.  Bocho Balls and the Dragon Rolll were great.

8cCmfAqZgIB6RYsXceKE9A.text: We eat a lot of sushi being from Hawaii. This place is TOP NOTCH!!!! Some of the best sushi we've ever had! Love the rolls and hamachi Kama. We will definitely be back!

N_2bsannDQ0PTXCKyMmE2g.text: Place was excellent food and service were great. Expected AYCE but they have changed the menu no longer available. Even so he food was superior came during their special happy hour and got 30% off. Well worth the $70 for two people.

GzoMfAZ2WwxjIPMUSuI0hg.text: So I wanted to find an awesome AYCE  sushi place closer to the house.  I looked on Yelp and found the place closed at 10:30 and I knew I was going to be cutting it close.  So I called and spoke with a Carlos and asked what time the last seating was, just to make sure I wasn't imposing.  Most places will set their final seating an hour before they really mean to close.  Kaya Sushi for example close at 3am on most days so they set their final seating at 2:15am.  Well Carlos, told me their final seating was 10:15 pm, so I was off.  I get to the downtown area and find a parking spot about a block away, which is as expected.  I paid for my parking spot and headed to Bocho Sushi.  I walked in and there were still about a dozen people in the place in various phases of their meal. I checked the time and thought awesome I made it (10:14pm). I ask the host if I can eat at the bar and she begins to seat me.  I start getting settled in and she asked if I was there for all you can eat or ala carte.  I stated all you can eat...  And she began telling me about it when one of the chefs said, No!  No, all you can eat after 10:15.  The hostess seemed somewhat surprised at this and briefly questioned it before apologizing and offering the ala carte menu.  But since I am on a mission to find a closer AYCE I declined.  I might try this place again but for two employees to seem to think it was ok for AYCE only to be over ruled by the chef after the customer looked for parking and paid for parking not to mention took the time and energy to give the establishment a try for the first time is somewhat unacceptable in my opinion, not to mention the communication breakdowns.    Now let me just clarify for those who will say yeah but with big parties I would want to serve super late either....  Well, I was by myself so it wasn't like I was entertaining a large party.  I was on a mission, so to speak!  Lol.   Well, back to the drawing board on the mission.  As they say in Football...  Next man (AYCE Place in this case) up.

XkaD9V9ipFrF2z5x4ZmplQ.text: I wanted do something special for sushi in Vegas and looked at the usual more expensive options. But Yelp reviews pointed me here and I was not disappointed.  The Yellowtail ceviche is awesome. The what's wrong roll (spicy) was amazing. The staff is friendly and very attentive. And happy hour until 6 is 30% off. This is a great sushi bar.

r9YO7d58gOee03KTqf47JQ.text: Rick and Juliette were super helpful and sweet! Food was great. They even accommodated for my dietary needs.

amCJiliFeyzO-qg-suRINg.text: Stopped in on the way through vegas and were surprised at the excellent food. The sashimi was amazing, the presentation beautiful, and the service was quick and friendly.

LeJgjD0jQAV4b1zedfolcw.text: Not sure how this is the best sushi people ever ate in their life or the best sushi downtown.  Although I don't know of any other.  After this having been on our list for a few months to try, we were extremely disappointed.  While the staff was attentive and great and we went on a Friday night and it was empty with one other customer.  The sushi itself was very subpar.  The rice was gummy and crunchy. The sea weed wraps were tough and gummy and chewy.  A few bites nearly felt like chewing gum and I think the fish itself at one time was rubbery.  I have not even eaten grocery store sushi, but I imagine it might be better.  I have had good sushi, I know I am somewhat a snob, but this was no where near the best anything.  It was not authentic in any way.  Nor was the staff.   If Taco Bell is your favorite Mexican.  This place is for you.

xoKSGx_bIhbdZmy1bSlWhg.text: We accidentally stumbled into this place and we are glade we did !!!! The food is amazing as well as the service. We are definitely going back when in Vegas again, no longer eating in the hotels when hidden gems like this are out their as well!!

QvkSOLL1gemXEk0ZDtUt6A.text: Great sushi, inventive rolls. Waitress knows her sake!

Epkpdrlv-alomspUWCq2sQ.text: Amazing service. The sushi chefs and hostess were so friendly. The sushi was phenomenal. Delicious and fresh. This was better than any other place I'd eaten

M4GbqCDyCMNAgsMA_MAL1Q.text: This is actually one of my favorite sushi bars in downtown Las Vegas. Yes it is a little bit expensive but the quality is great!

lsYtXF289qCToViUaOuP9A.text: We had a great NYE dinner here. We sat in the upstairs area which features a dining area, bar and karaoke rooms. Being from SoCal, I'm very picky about my sushi and this spot was great. The sushi was fresh and the service fantastic. One tiny ding was that the roll we received was cold...popsicle cold. I more like my sushi at room temp. Other than that, spot on and will be back.

HdqDIOqRoA9a-L7tBvi7ow.text: Bocho blew me away.  Its a great little spot in the downtown area, off the strip! From the outside you wouldn't think to stop in, but its definitely worth the visit.  The sushi bar area is small, but they have a dining area upstairs, and a full bar. A great place for a date, as its intimate, only about 10-12 tables.  All of the food here was incredible.

f4Wk0LdLqTTChQf5YzxqIg.text: Had a great double date here with friends from out of town. Environment is good, drinks were good, food was great. Service was a little spotty, but very relational throughout evening. Would definitely eat here again.

RVKu9GUE2yc4BJX0nC9h1w.text: I went here many months ago for lunch, right after they first opened.  Food is good but the service was terrible. I decided not to Yelp then, because I know it can take time for new restaurants to "work out the kinks". Went back today (at least 6 months later) for lunch, and it was the same thing- food was good, service was just unacceptable. I will not be back, which is a shame since I work so close and love sushi.

ucVz4R3bHfOsRtVX9uAoRA.text: The atmosphere is great! Quaint little place in the heart of downtown. Food was good, but on the whole, nothing especially stands out. We ordered the jalepeno bomb, which is worth it. The spicy tuna and salmon were good, but you can't really mess those ones up. The rainbow roll was, well, a rainbow roll. Good. The yellowtail lover I was really looking forward to bc of all the reviews on here, but it was a little underwhelming. The plain spicy salmon and tuna rolls were better. The fried icecream was delicious though, and pretty presentation. It's big enough to share. Service was good...and until a larger louder party came in, the place was perfect for a nice quiet evening out.

W-7rBX_9LUEwzRp3Ee4X2A.text: The sushi was ooooooooookkkkk nothing to rave about. I had high expectations from this place, but I have had way better sushi and quality.

94uNZiu8vaoV9giX4l7U-w.text: Awesome atmosphere right when you walk in plus the sushi rolls are too knotch.  I'm visiting from California and I will definitely come back with friends.

lFcib84bXGiir4BDZTIHDQ.text: Looks not so great from the outside but great food. Reasonable prices 3 people for under $65. Small restaurant excellent service. Try Pink lady, Mr. Carson . nice portions. Will be back next time in town. Found it on yelp and was well worth it.

jr7699Vlf2PQsTcttx1zmg.text: I've given Bocho 3 chances to knock my socks off, and it just hasn't happened. The sushi is ok. The service is ok. The decor is ok. I wanted so badly to love it. There aren't many sushi spots downtown, but many other excellent restaurants. I'll have to get my sushi fix some place else.

The entire place was very classy and the food was delicious while still being cheaper than other sushi places around the area. Make sure to take advantage of the free saki shot by checking in. Would refer a friend and ask that they take me back!

QGGMCQyOj9a-wvCVRXz2kQ.text: Great food, nice atmosphere and wonderful service.  Great place for sushi that's not too far off the strip and walking distance from Fremont St.  I'd definitely come here again.

dUX9XO-db_iByKS8rxPeAw.text: I been here a few times...and I'm so happy with it. The staff is always friendly and engaging when you enter and throughout the dining experience. You have the option to dine at the sushi bar on the first floor or the main dining room on the second floor. The second floor is also where they have the private rooms for karaoke (I have yet to try). The restaurant is clean and new having just opened this year. Japanese warriors grace the walls, the stairs are adorned with samurai swords and bonsai trees at the sushi bar. AYCE is not offered here and I'm okay with that. I prefer quality over quantity. The rolls are handled with care and the specials are great. I enjoyed the Japanese Snapper nigiri and also had a chance to try the grilled Amber Jack collar. What a wonderful dish! My partner said the jalapeno bomb was the best he has had in the city. Not dry like others may have. Attention to detail and care for the outcome makes this number one in my book. Thank you to our great sushi chef June (sp?) who introduced us to the amber jack collar! We will be back.

Don't judge a book by it's cover.  Yummmy

LUWFkKOvlppPD760LTduhw.text: Neighborgood sushi joint. Keeps it simple. Knows what you want. Great service. Solid items. Catch the specials!

Sv_MNO1W-L6HxnyHrFFE-A.text: Bocho Sushi is a super cool trendy sushi spot downtown. They have all bar seats downstairs but there is an upstairs with tables. You can choose elevator or stairs which was nice because my bf is currently with crutches. The staff is very friendly and efficient. The price is a little high and their menu is a little small. We ordered salmon sashimi and the dirty sanchez roll which were both delicious and fresh. I would definitely recommend if your downtown!

lOCsg02UFxr-IMI4wdDMWw.text: I was looking for a good sushi spot near me, and saw this was the first on my list on Yelp. Located in Downtown Las Vegas literally 5 minutes away from me. Its next to Carson Kitchen that's how I was able to fin it so quickly. Cute little spot on the corner of 6th and Carson.   When you walk in its a sushi bar which you have the choice to sit there if you'd like or there is table seating upstairs. Very clean, small but cute and intimate. It was slow when we came, but I don't mind.  We first ordered the Garlic Edamame because we heard our neighbors order it. And I must say best decision on my life. Its a bit spicy but the flavor is amazing and the garlic is not over powering. I could not stop eating them. I wish I had a bowl for myself lol. We also ordered the Jalapeno Bombs which were stuffed with Spicy Tuna and Cream Cheese. Now when I hear Jalapeno Bomb I expected really spicy, but it wasn't that spicy. But still very good. They were deep fried and the jalapenos were fresh. Must try!! Then we ordered the Baked Salmon Roll, a California Roll with baked salmon right on top; very good and tasty. Fish was not too fishy and roll was cut perfectly. We also ordered the Las Vegas Roll which was amaaazing. had eel, cream cheese, avocado and crab - deep fried!! YUM!!   We ordered the perfect amount of food, and it was not expensive at all, it came out to $35. Not too bad! And if its your first time checking in through Yelp you get a free Sake shot. Our waiter gave me a free shot too!   I'd totally recommend this place to anyone looking for a good sushi spot to go to!

Photo of Bocho Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Salmon Roll

4Rf4t3TpMj8xjJksOFi55w.text: If you are a sushi afficiando and appreciate quality, fresh fish that is skillfully prepared, this is the place for you. The layout is basic -- a ring of chairs around a sushi bar (though maybe there's more space upstairs?). Some of the negative posts seem to be around the wait service, and I could see some wanting more, though they seemed aware of this feedback and were trying to improve the attentiveness. The head sushi chef is an artisan. I don't know what higher praise I can give than this: Bocho Sushi is *legit*.

KMQwE5I6qgG2BoLb6EAKBg.text: This sushi was amazing and we were able to get a free hot sake shot off of this app! Tried the seaweed salad and it was fantastic. Highly recommend.

Ae0rF5mu-xEd1IXYj-UHuA.text: Walking distance from Fremont and the Container park; Bocho was a great find. Our server Melissa was also very pleasant and helpful with our menu selection. You have to try the "Something Wrong Roll" it's the Chef Choice. My husband and I really enjoyed it.

Jh1q1KxEelfJjqPRW0aOfA.text: Amazing highly recommend  the yellow tial sashimi, poke monster, and dirty Sanchez!!! All Soo good!

Z3mMvmiBzs6CsWb1BoxQLQ.text: Let me precedent, we are basic sushi goers.. you can't get more basic than we are, so take that into consideration in our review. If you are a sushi connoisseur move on to the next review! That being said we loved this place. Service and ambiance are a total win. They have a legit happy hour with 30% off the whole menu! The place played sweet jams the whole time & the sushi chef's seemed to really enjoy the job and super engaged in what they were doing. (Carlos was our guy) Overall super great little sushi spot in downtown.. will definitely be back for another happy hour.

BzhZ_1T7_-kWwXj3paApSg.text: I spent 2 days looking for a good sushi place in both the strip & here & finally won. Service is great & the sushi is fantastic. This is the best part of my 3 day exploration. Thank you Bocho staff!

0ZJwQ9fp4g0O4jFLV-MssA.text: SWEET SUSHI I think I may have found my spot! Stumbled upon this hidden gem located Downtown near the arts district on a Friday night. There's no signage above the spot other that a sign right on the Windows so you'd have to look for other landmarks. (Hint: it's right around the corner from the Commonwealth bar and there's a hotel sign right above)  From the hostess who sat us down at the sushi bar to the waitress and the busser, I'd have to say all 3 were very attentive.  Our Sushi Chef's name was John and man oh man John was definitely THE MAN of the night! We sat at the bar to watch him at his craft and it was definitely an artistry (see pics posted).  We started with the Kampachi Sashimi which I have no words for. It was simply perfect and melted right in my mouth. Next was a soft shell crab hand roll topped with salmon. The salmon was like butter as you bite into a crispy soft shell crab. We had quite a bit more after these but the rest is history as I could go on and on. My advice is you have to just go there and see for yourself because everything was great!

xxZ3Z1XoWR8CReEtqViGIA.text: Were to begin? Well I've actually been looking for this place for quite sometime to write this review. My family and I came in for a few drinks and appetizers. My father was drinking a beer and the glass had chipped off in his mouth which cut his tongue on the inside. We asked to speak to the manager(he stated he was the co owner as well not sure if he still is the manager believe his name was carlos) he approached us extremely rude did not even care! He thought the best way to apologize would be a free beer and no sincerity at all! So we asked him to stop our order we were not going to stay there another minute especially after how rude he was. SO then He proceeded to yell across the bar and say "don't worry you don't have to pay for anything" in a sarcastic tone. Making it seem like we wanted free stuff all and he was trying to embarrass us all the costumers turned toward us so embarrassing all we wanted was some sincerity because a chipped glass could of really hurt someone. He probably thought we drunk and he could take advantage of that. I really could not believe it! Not cool at all I hope no one else experiences this ever

E1qgUIGVU1GpYeSFI9_NZw.text: This place is definitely good! I went here with a friend and got there about 15 minutes before happy hour was over and they let us do it anyway.   We ordered a few rolls and they were all delicious. The fish tastes fresh and the rolls didn't fall apart.   The ambiance is nice and mellow and it's off Fremont street so it isn't crazy busy or hard to find parking.   We go to pay for our check and forgot we were there during happy hour and our waiter realized he charged us full price so he fixed it before running our card. That's awesome and shows integrity of their employees since we didn't even notice the difference before lol   Definitely coming back here, they rock.

EW80ZNF2GObhW73ryd1EUw.text: Four stars because service wasn't good. Our server was pretty rude when we tried to be polite. Anyway, the food was amazing. Best ramen I've had. Shrimp tempura roll was typical nothing special. The poke monster was really great. The fried calamari was also amazing. Food 10/10 service 3/10

33sM5st0-Sz5oH58RZf7tQ.text: We were wanting to try a new sushi place and this place hit the spot! Incredibly delicious!! Great service, great food, great experience overall! Had the garlic edamame which were surprisingly spicy (didn't expect that) also had the jalapeno bombs that, from reading previous reviews is a must, and it REALLY is a MUST!!! We asked for a second order from how delicious the first order was! Also tried the Las Vegas roll and WTF which were equally delicious. Had the samurai drink that was strong yet sweet, went smell with the calamari skewers! Definitely coming back!

WJ02hTcHK8z52X7Tu3ChEw.text: Looks are deceiving. Gorgeous restaurant in a prime downtown location serving up lousy seafood and sushi.  I have given this place 3 chances and I never want to risk my stomach here again. The rolls are uninspired. The nigiri are dry with questionable fish. The sushi rice is hard and difficult to digest. Time and time again we are extremely disappointed with everything we have tried here. Unfortunately, I would never recommend this place to anyone.   Such a disaster!

LX8p4gYTYv3NTVWB_ed1WQ.text: In a nutshell: Flavorful food, great atmosphere.  Popped in for lunch at 11. You can sit immediately at the sushi bar or upstairs at a table. The menu has a variety of sushi, some bento boxes, some specials, and some appetizers. Some of the sushi has cheeky names. I ordered the Miso Hungry Ramen and my wife ordered Tuna Tare Tare. We also got a app of vegi spring rolls. The food was served in a normal amount of time and the presentation of the food was very nice! The tuna was in a nifty tower shape and had little crunchy wanton chips with it. My ramen was steaming hot and presented with a half an hard boiled egg and pork belly nicely showcased in the broth. The ramen was very flavorful and yummy. The pork belly was grilled. The noodles were plentiful and there wasn't too much of any one thing. The tuna Tare Tare was reported as being "suuuuper good!" The spring rolls were fried perfectly and were very tasty. The only minus to this experience was the music; if 7 is a good listening volume, the music in here was at 8, just one too loud. And newer rock music, which would be on any other day for me, super aggravating at that volume.  Real good service, really good food, great atmosphere. Loud on this day.  A hot tip for you: if you happened to park across the street, PAY ON THAT SIDE. I paid on the other side of the street closest to the restaurant and I got a ticket. Frown.

Qbi7YBIxcdhoV44mhKf1Qg.text: Sadly I have to give this place a poor rating. The menu has changed for the worst since April 2019. For example the chief special during happy hours is no longer available. All of the happy hour special rolls went from $10 to $13. Now there are three rolls that are no longer available for happy hour option. The beer selection is PBR.....at a sushi restaurant? That's unfortunate that the owner can't supply Sapporo to match the menu. Granted I know the quality of seafood is top notch. Unfortunately this establishment has turn into a strip restaurant rather a downtown local spot. Guess it was good while it lasted.

OHcTHZwf1V7ZNZiHaNwwRg.text: I was quite a fan of this spot. We just needed a quick bite to eat before we saw a musical at the smith center. We were seated quickly upstairs which was super cute.   We ordered three rolls and soup and it filled both of us right out. It was soooo tasty and fresh. I definitely want to come back here because it was so yummy. There wasn't a bland part about it and it was pretty dang cheap too. The presentation was adorable.   My girlfriend even got a free shot of Sake since I was a Yelper! We will be back.

r7zSMvTisjT_vh2WiUqIKA.text: I honestly think I came during a very dull night. I'm not expecting much but the service was extremelyyyyy slow and mediocre. The workers do not look happy at all as they moved in the slowest pace possible.  When we were led to our table it was dirty so we asked the busboy if he can clean it but he gave us an awkward reply saying he was going to clean it but we sat already. I don't know why the host led us to that table if it wasn't even ready. No big deal anyways we were excited to try this place out!  Next thing, the restaurant wasn't even busy but it took really long for anyone to help us. Then it took about 30 minutes for us to get our sushi rolls. I felt like everyone in the restaurant got their orders before we did. I think they might have forgotten us until they realize we had nothing on our table for awhile. But anyways, ordered some of the sushi rolls and some of the fish were still thawing. Flavor wise, not too bad but nothing desirable.  If you got lots of time to kill and want to watch people eat their meal and then leave before you even get your food, then this is most definitely the spot to be. Unfortunately, the overall experience and service was why we could not appreciate what other yelpers saw.

oWynnVMb2NUZ98fAPwKjJQ.text: Love, love, love this place. One of my favorite parts about DT, always feel right at home. But the quality of food & service you receive really depends on when you're there. I like to get there around 8-8:30 before the dinner rush pours in, because it can get SO busy SO fast that it's hard for the servers to keep up, (understandably!) Really liked chef Daniel but he's no longer here :( My new favorite is V. He's the only one (so far) that makes a roll that is both delicious & absolutely beautiful at the same time. (Refer to my latest pic of the veggie roll, just perfecto). I believe he works tues & wed nights, & most afternoons, so you must stop in when he's working & have him serve you. ALSO cannot forget RYAN, such a sweetie.

_9aVrTNJrFGndt7_-0mTUw.text: This was place was amazing. Not sure the chef's name...it was Tuesday for lunch he was on the left. He did such a great job and seemed very proud of what was coming out of the kitchen.   Usually the food I eat in Vegas is subpar...enough to almost satisfy your craving but never yummy. This place was all yummy and did not disappoint at all. Fish tasted fresh and the presentation was perfect. My only wish is that I didn't come here earlier on my holiday.

_Lw4f4Y-A5p3znQxtmIX2g.text: Top notch sushi and service. Had the Toro daily special with black pepper to start (and the chef tossed in two pieces of fried Toro; this was amazing). Then moved on to the fried shrimp dumplings, then the Carson & 6th roll. And to top it off, the chef offered to make a roll based on my preferences. I said I like tuna and what I go was easily one of the better rolls I got. Regular and spicy bluefin on the inside toped with yellow tail and a spicy sauce topping. If in Downtown and you like sushi...then do yourself well, and get here

sY30r4Z_5IXcA_XL9rxGIQ.text: We were exploring Las Vegas downtown Fremont Street. As we had cravings for sushi and so we decided to check out this place as the reviews were very good.  From the exterior, it didn't look like a restaurant. But ambiance and service was good. Sushi chef was nice and friendly.  Sushi in general were good just that the size of the sushi was tiny. It's more like kid's menu. The size of the rice was quite the same as that of the fish... so I guess a bit mini...  Price was okay just that if we took into consideration the size of the sushi... I guess it's a bit overpriced.  It's not a restaurant that we will revisit when we are around next time.

_7KRFbpY9yGTuoCzd_KGcw.text: I have been here for almost an hour and have only received one of my sushi rolls. It took 45 minutes before the waiter told us our rolls were being made. We just received our second rolls. One of us ordered miso soup and still have not gotten it. The waiter is doing both waiting on tables and helping in the bar. It was not busy when we came in and I saw people come in after us and get food before us. Our waiter kept asking us if our food had come yet but he was the one who was picking up all the orders and bringing the food to the tables.   I was told by the waiter that one of the rolls, the Poke Monster, was a large roll enough for two. It was smaller than a the rest of the rolls.   The menu is pretty limited. Not a big variety at all. Actually our soup finally arrived. It's super hot and only one piece of tofu. I will definitely not come back here.

5-rSc9AHURy8VeV3tF0jYg.text: Great spot for downtown sushi!! The sushi chefs are amazing! I'm always seemingly in a rush and they never fail to get my order going and to feed me! The fish is amazing quality and the service is super fast and efficient great spot!!!

PcTFnaj4u_4EGQpjyv8_QA.text: If you are craving a great fresh sushi with coolest staff this would be your sushi place!! Bocho was in a very convenient location in downtown! This place isn't big though so sometimes you have to hit the timing right to be able to eat at the bar with the sushi chef! But man they never disappoint!   So Andrew is probably one of the coolest sushi chef I have ever met! He recommend things and makes us special sushi for my husband that does not eat raw fishes! :/ see it's kinda hard when you have a picky husband that eats like a 5years old child Lol.. my husband is super picky and he doesn't even eat seaweed! And not a lot of sushi chef are not very patience when handling our orders!   Anyway; Daniel and Crystal (that's apparently leaving) are also the most down to earth people we have met down here! Bocho Sushi have created an environment where they will make sure their customers are well taken care of! And they will get to know you and sit down with you! They treat you like a family instead of just another customer customer walking in!   Now let's get to the food portion of the review; sushi are the bomb here! We order Vegas rolls I believe it's called lol. It's like an explosion in your mouth!!! And this roll does not have any rice in it! Man.. they were spicy and sweet at the same time! And all those seafood just melted in your mouth! Soo gooodd. I'm getting hungry just writing this!   And the second roll we ordered was baked salmon! That salmon though! Andrew you are the man!! Glistening pink on the inside and cooked perfectly out and super flaky! Just pretty epic I would say!   And we also ordered their fried chicken which what we always get there and baked mussels!   Well after all!!!! It's always a pleasure with this guy! Never a complaint and if I can give them 100stars I really really would!! Thank you guys so much!! Keep it up!!

ly38IkENN0Hs_GctGe-KDQ.text: If you're looking for sushi in las Vegas, stay off the strip and check out this hidden gem just east of Fremont St! Phenomenal sushi, I recommend the garlic tuna and the special roll called "number 5". Great staff, drink list, and ambiance. Whenever we're in town, we always make sure to eat here at least once.

FmNG8mhzO6CiqfeyuimPCg.text: food and service was excellent, tuna sashimi was great, portions  were over expectations, reasonable priced.

HNrASXoC5QlnMk4wooTg2g.text: Wonderful little place. My fiance and I loved our meal. Very friendly staff. Next time in Vegas we will definitely be back!

DcOk3fnc47b5jxXMtlMUKQ.text: Great little sushi spot. Excellent Sushi and excellent prices. Came in to grab some take out order and the staff was extremely hospitable. The ambiance was also very hip.

jPoHvONIzayGCaITlsJTMA.text: The bartender at Oak and Ivy suggested Bocho when we asked about a local sushi restaurant in the Las Vegas downtown area.  This was walking distance from Oak and Ivy (check them out for excellent cocktails.) We sat at the sushi bar and watched the three talented chefs.  We had hot green tea, a couple of regular rolls and a couple of the special rolls- the WTF (with soft shell crab) and the Yellowtail Lover. The sushi and sashimi they were serving were beautifully prepared.  The rolls were excellent- fresh, flavorful with not a single cheap shortcut to be found in anything we ordered.  Prices were very good.  We'll make a point of returning next time we're in town.

keX8NASfcoc8Ay8IYu7AIQ.text: Good sushi!! The place is located on a very quiet, kindda ghetto part of Fremont but the sushi is excellent.

BfpxUcSmsJI7o_a-S513Yg.text: Really great rolls. Best I think I have ever had. My friend had the curry and he said it was the best he had ever had as well. The staff was friendly well informed and great at what they do. Had a calm relaxing time with a small group and it was the best food I have had in Vegas so far.

eTTP3anME_lsmMnBI5UdLw.text: My friend raves about this place constantly and her FB photos make me hungry.  Finally got a chance to try it out on Saturday and it was delicious!  We got the scallop sushi, Pink Lady Roll, Number 5, Chicken appetizer,and Sake Sushi.  Pink Lady Roll was perfect mixture of textures and flavors.  Chicken was deliciously seasoned and fried to perfection.  But our all time favorite was the scallop sushi, sweet with crispy onion and some sort of amazing sauce.  We loved it so much we wanted to pick up some scallop sushi on our way to the airport.  Sadly, they're closed on Sunday. Oh, did I mention very reasonably priced?!!

37wFUNFQwA45BiWa8BR2ww.text: First off I have never in my life had Sushi, that being said i found i enjoyed most of what I had a pleasant surprise if you will. We attended a company party so we had the intire upstairs to ourselves and a serving table which the kept in rotation. I have to say I do not know exactly what all I was eating and it maybe a good thing for my own mind but, I really dint find anything I did not really care for.. I did avoid the raw fish items by themselves but tried all the types of rolls and fried items they served.. wonderful flavors..  I do have to say this place is small. Seating as you come in is mostly counter and limited on space. I expected a smell to be in the air but found there was nothing to really smell.. the items where they where preparing the food all looked very fresh. Staff is very friendly and attentive. The up stairs i a small table/ bench type area with limited seating and 2 small karaoke rooms and a stand up bar. Pace is very clean and comforting. I can see myself going back..

7DLu8hWonwWOPO00sz5V7Q.text: The food quality is actually quite good, but despite that, I have to give this place the fewest stars possible. Good fish does not begin to make up for the worst omakase experience I have ever had. We arrived about 1 hour prior to closing and asked if they could do the $75 a head, 2 person minimum omakase. They took our order, with no indication of a problem, then proceeded to pile food in front of us as fast as they could make it. Some things were one per person, some were evidently meant to be shared. No explanation of what was being served. At one point the waitress took an untouched dish from its serving tray and put it on our side plates so that she could add another dish in front of us. Meanwhile they're sweeping up around us. 25 minutes before closing we indicated we were feeling rushed. Our server hid in a corner. The manager? apologized, but the damage was done. To be honest, the apology did not seem that genuine anyways. They took a small percentage off our bill, and I'm pretty sure we never got the full omakase (I've never had one that didn't include some kind of dessert). We certainly will not return.

1Gpchs6GIvy7wr1OTm4vlQ.text: Great spot off the strip. Roll number #5 was amazing. Friendly service and comfortable environment. Seemed very local. Worth the uber from the strip.

HDUAdP8UQeJCxgw3efN8cQ.text: Good food but inconsistent with quality. Some days I'll order something and it's a great portion, and another day, I'll order the same thing, and the it's presented poorly like someone who was training made the roll.

sukrkcOi4qcW9JxHepXUCQ.text: I was impressed with the unagi and the servers and chefs were very friendly. Will be coming back often.

LaYVVn6aF6BQNmKQu0BqQg.text: This place is totally the spot. My friend and I probably come here once a week. I gave 3 stars because everything is a bit overpriced. And the hit and miss service. Basic rolls are 4-5$ more than average... like NOBU prices! A half dozen of oysters is like 15$ (ive literally bit into pieces of shells) and they're so tiny! Even the hot sake and asahi is expensive! The location is downtown which is awesome because there aren't that many sushi places over there!   Their baked mussels (I've eaten many shells inside the baked mussel) , rolls, rock shrimp and sake are to die for! Service is usually a hit or miss. I've literally had to go to the bar and demand service. The last 3 times I was there it was only 3 tables upstairs and they always forget everything I order! I absolutely love the second floor karaoke/bar area. The interior and layout of the place is for sure a win.

cJlE0xtLw6PRJHuStxjZeA.text: Was quickly seated since had made reservation ahead of time. I was excited based on a good reviews. We had the sashimi platter, and hamachikama, and one of their specialty rolls. Overall, the fish was great quality and hamachikama was massive, but the wait was just too long. Took forever for the sashimi platter to come out, and when it did we were starving so obviously it was gone in a jiffy...then another wait for the roll. We had told our waitress our order, but I dont think it was communicated to the chef, since he only started making the roll after he checked in on us while we were waiting. The chefs were fun and hard working, but I think the communication and time management is a bit lacking. Totally recommend the hamachikama, super yummy. Then the last long wait was for the check, our waitress was too busy talking story and had forgotten that we asked for our check. Overall, would not come back.

oDphl1trQbMTwyXHa-vnCQ.text: Hidden secret if you can get their. Yum if you make it. A small sushi bar around 15 around the downtown area. We had to ask how to get their. Way cool. Food delish. I would recommend. Artsy keepdown town alive!  We need more spots like this.

E4tSs52SmdkfoR0WWdYICQ.text: We walk in and it seems like a cool environment. We sit down and everything is cool. They ordered our drinks just fine and then they took our order. 40 minutes later we are wondering where our 3 California rolls are. On top of waiting 40 minutes the guy making sushi walked back to the kitchen 4 times and every time he came back eating food with his gloves on, then he starts eating in front of us and has food all over his mouth and doesn't even notice it & continues on making our food. After all this he takes a 10 minute break standing right here drinking soda when we still don't have our rolls. The nastiest part is that HE NEVER CHANGED HIS GLOVES AFTER WALKING INTO THE KITCHEN AND EATING FREAKING FOOD AND USING THE SODA MACHINE. I'm disgusted with this

APwzioM0ly77afhbeA3BcQ.text: A hip, contemporary sushi spot was what downtown Vegas was missing, and Bocho filled that void. With competitive prices and scrumptious menu items, it gives other restaurants in the area a run for their money.   Regular lunch and dinner menus are offered, but if you want the AYCE experience, you can have that too. Both my friend and I ordered the AYCE dinner, which is 30 bucks per person. The menu is unlike the exhaustive list of specialty rolls, entrees, and appetizers found at other sushi restaurants; although, it doesn't include items offered on their regular menu.   Sitting on the second floor loft beats eating at the crowded sushi bar. I do like how the two are separated. The bar was much busier and louder as opposed to the laid-back atmosphere above. Plus, the seats are cushioned and there are pillows!  Here's what I ordered, and I'd most likely select these again.  * Calamari Skewers (yeaah, squid on a stick!) * Baked Salmon Roll * Crunch Dragon Roll * Las Vegas Roll * Unagi * Masago (no quail egg available) * Garlic tuna  * Fatty tuna  * Octopus   My favorite roll was the baked salmon with cream cheese, avocado, crab, and baked salmon on the outside. The sashimi was also delicious. I wouldn't mind returning to eat just sashimi and calamari skewers.   Our food arrived promptly, and the service was great. I'll definitely be returning.

laRVUC8b7A8zUelO2EMGsg.text: We stumbled into this little sushi joint near the Fremont District at the corner of Carson and 6th Street, very little room with a sushi bar and few seating when we first enter, we then went upstairs to the second floor, much bigger space and to our surprise there're two party rooms with kareoke. Place is clean and the waitress is very nice, lovely lady.   We ordered few dishes on the board, monkey brain, etc. I don't remember other names but the rolls are amazing! We loved the icy cold draft beer on this scorching  sunny day along with some appetizers and cold sake. Prices is right too. Good experience for us!

pmL8SW7LWk0-qiUQH0MOyQ.text: This is a hidden gem in downtown Las Vegas.  My wife and I wanted sushi before visiting the neon museum and this fit the bill.  The food and staff are second to none.  I would easily pay double for this quality and service likely on the strip.  Highly encourage anyone to try it.  Easy parking available in a lot across the street.  The roll prices are very affordable and they have specials.  My wife really enjoyed their tuna with crispy rice.  We also tried the melting albacore and ate many rolls that were out of this world.  Everything tasted extremely fresh and we hope to visit it again.  They might be in the middle of the desert but the fish is as fresh as anywhere.  Give it a shot and don't forget the garlic edamame! Yum

T20DPi9EMYZC8uSASR45PA.text: I love this place. There's a wide variety of sushi available from the basics, to the grandiose. I personally am a fan of the Las Vegas roll, mm. Cream cheese and avocado and deep fried methods are my jam. Or in this case, my roll...  Also, I will come back here time and time again for the salmon sashimi. First of all, the presentation is very refreshing. It's served on ice, with the standard ginger, wasabi, and garnishings. I love that they include an orchid flower. Definitely is a nice touch! But let me tell you, the salmon itself had me falling asleep dreaming about it all night afterwards. It's very fresh, buttery, and overall just delicious. I'd come back just for that.   Sitting at the bar is fun too! The guys working back there are pretty fun to talk to and interact with.  I only knocked it down one star because parking is a hassle, but with downtown that's expected. Hey, at least you can walk off all that sashimi afterwards!

gLoAQhG12_AlygTtpXKvOA.text: Amazing.  Got pork belly skewers, fried soft scab, and a special toll called something right with house hot sake.  It was something right.

LOAPdF7zwzzTMKYuneqLAQ.text: Bocho can be kind of an odd choice if what you are looking for is just a traditional sushi place, and I admit I didn't really care for it the first time I visited because I had that expectation. Now, I crave it. It is actually a fantastic kind of fusion that fits the location - the fried chicken bites are shockingly tasty (that mustard!), and the bento boxes are a great deal. I love the bright bar area for a quick lunch and the staff have been on point every time I have been.

ARaWs4Iv5_m2IJKyr3INKA.text: I don't think I've ever had a bad experience here. Yesterday I took a much needed lunch break to enjoy some sushi. I decided on the spicy tuna roll and the lunch bento box which made me more than full. If you're trying to come here during the 11-3 lunch hour and don't want sushi I say get the lunch box/ lunch ramen choices for $11, drink included! More bang for your buck. If, in fact, you have chosen to take a later lunch or head over for happy hour I believe they have sushi 20% off from 3-6, which is great. The sushi is always fresh and the waiters are super nice. I even heard that there's a spot upstairs for karaoke.   Definitely worth the trek to downtown Fremont.

We gave this place a chance cause our other place we liked last time was closed, and damn am I happy we tried this place.   This place is very small and probably only seats about 15 total. We went in and there were three other people, so we got nice quick service. The menu is a little small, but the sushi chef was able to make anything you requested. I asked if he could make a Caterpillar roll (as it was not on the menu) and he gave me one of the best Caterpillar rolls I've ever had. The sushi was fresh, the restaurant was clean, and the service was quick. Definitely try this place if you're in old Vegas.

kK42OyItHAeOpyLOXUrxqQ.text: What happens when you're stuck with jury duty and you don't want to eat at the Capriotti's in the Regional Justice Center? You go exploring, you go yelping, and you settle on a restaurant that's not too far away! I came across Bocho Sushi during a yelp search and found out that they had lunch specials! Perfect!   I ended up sitting at the bar when I got there because it was just wee lil ol me. Why take up a table? I'm not sure if it's standard procedure since I wasn't ordering sushi but no one stopped me or said no! So off I roll ...  I decided to get their chicken bento box, which came with chicken, rice, mixed tempura, salad, AND a fountain drink for $11.00. Honestly, the price is amazing especially since it comes with a drink. It is also a good portion of food for me. If you tend to have bigger meals, it may not be enough food.   Their chicken was very tender. It wasn't a huge piece -- pretty thin but I don't think it was breast meat. They do drizzle some teriyaki sauce on top! But I think I preferred it without the sauce hahaha! The tempura was decent. I did not eat too much of the salad because their dressing was a ginger based dressing and I'm not a fan of ginger. The only thing is that the rice was a bit dried out? It almost seems it's kind of old. Overall, it's pretty decent. I've had a better bento box elsewhere but for the price and location, definitely worth it!   I didn't try any of their sushi so I can't really comment on that but my friend loves this place :)  Their service is pretty good! Very accommodating and very nice! They're all pretty friendly and funny too. Definitely a nice place to hang out with friends or just chat with the sushi chef.

The only thing that stayed the same is the salmon kama but half the size and twice the price. Im not sure I would ever go back again, too bad it used to be so good.

T8eOEBBN6KJZoCEDdZ4xGQ.text: Solid. Fresh sushi for a great price off the strip. We had a table for 8 people. Ordered a ton and ate a ton. Nice place in downtown Vegas for Sushi. They didn't have AYCE when we showed up but it didn't matter. We got what we wanted.
